questions.lead: Conflict bubbles up from different areas; carelessness, misunderstanding, personality clash, stubborness, jealousy and being wronged. Which of these resonates with you?
followup: How can you look to resolve these things before it grows?
There is a bigger conflict between God and us caused by sin? How does change how you see conflict?

questions.lead: How did Jonty explain verse three; that we will judge the angels?
followup: How do you feel about this truth that Paul writes?
How does this change or challenge your view of conflict resolution?

questions.lead: In verse seven, Paul challenges the church 'Why not rather be wronged?'. Why don't we like this challenge?
followup: How does the gospel message of Christ crucified change our natural resistance to this?
Do you have any conflicts in your life that you need to resolve?
